text:
I've successfully RE-installed windows 10 on devices born with windows 7 and 8
many times since the cut-off 6 weeks ago using Windows 10 22H2 media and
selecting "I don't have a key" during installation. It still reads the Win7/8
tattoo and activates Win10 fine. However, I have now experienced problems on two
devices that never did the "free" upgrade prior to the September policy change
that are unable to activate Windows 10 after upgrading to v1607 or v22H2. In
both cases I just convinced the owner to buy new computers - their machines are
already 10 years old so it's not worth trying to force it. I suspect the device
I upgraded last month from Win7 to Win10 that activated fine probably
experienced the forced upgrade to Win10 at some point and the owner reverted to
7 and just never went back to 10. The device was still eligible since it had
been upgraded at some point. -S
Link: None

metadata.subject: RE: [patchmanagement] Updating New Teams
